instruction: Sign the letters "O" and "K".

Begin with the fingertip of your middle finger of your dominant hand against the palm side of your non-dominant hand. Then move the fingertips of your index and middle fingers up to your mouth a couple of times.
Place both hands in front of your with your thumbs pointing toward your chest. Alternate bringing your hands toward your chest and dragging your thumbs down on your chest.
Begin with the fingertips of your dominant hand on the palm of your non-dominant hand. Bring your dominant hand to your forehead while also bringing your fingertips together.

definition: A color made from red and blue.
instruction: Begin with your hand in front of you with your index finger pointing forward and your palm oriented downward. Then, slightly rotate your wrist from side to side a couple of times.

definition: Question word asking about a person.
instruction: Begin with your hand in front of your face with your palm oriented to the side, your thumb against your chin, and your index finger pointing up. Then, curl your index finger slightly down a couple of times.
Move your thumb across your jaw a couple of times.

Place your non-dominant hand under the elbow of your dominant hand. The dominant hand should be open with the fingers together. Begin the sign with the dominant hand facing forwards and slightly bent down, and then angle the forearm and hand downwards 2 times.

definition: A primary color like the sky.
instruction: Place your hand in front of you with your fingers vertical. Slightly rotate your wrist back and forth a couple of times.

Place the fingertips of your non-dominant hand together and keep it in front of you for the duration of the sign. With a "1" handshape, your dominant hand will begin by being placed on the index finger of the other hand, and then making a circle around the other hand.
Begin with both hands next to each other on the thumb side of your hands. Then, rotate your wrists until your hands make contact on the pinkie side of your hands.

definition: Unit of time equal to 60 seconds.
instruction: With both palms oriented toward each other, place your dominant hand near the top of the fingers of your non-dominant hand. Then, slightly move the index finger of your dominant hand back and forth a couple of times.

Slide the fingertips of the thumb and index finger of your dominant hand across the palm of your non-dominant hand 2 times, then sign "person". This sign is a combination of the signs for "count" and "person".
Begin with your hand in front of your forehead and bring your fingertips together 2 times.

Begin with both hands in front of you with the wrist of your dominant hand slightly above the back of your non-dominant hand. Then, move your dominant hand slightly to the side a couple of times, making contact with the back of your dominant hand each time.

definition: Woody plant with trunk and branches.
instruction: Begin with your non-dominant hand underneath the elbow of your dominant hand. Your dominant hand should be vertical with the palm of your dominant hand oriented to the inside. Then, slightly rotate your wrist from side to side a couple of times.
Begin with both hands in a "1" handshape near, but slightly below your face. Alternate moving your index fingers from both hands away and towards yourself a couple of times.

definition: Engage in a job or task.
instruction: Tap the wrist area of your dominant hand on top of the back of your non-dominant hand. Your dominant hand should be vertical and oriented away from yourself, and your non-dominant hand should be oriented down and set out in front of you.
Begin with both palms against each other with all your fingers except for your thumbs facing forwards. Then, rotate your hands up until those fingers are facing upwards.

Begin with your hand near your shoulder and your hand turned so that your thumb is facing up. Then move your hand away from you, while wiggling your hand, mimicking the movement of a fish through the water.
Move your hands against your face a couple of times with your thumb and index fingers making the outline of eyeglasses.

definition: Flat green part of a plant.
instruction: Begin with your dominant hand oriented down and the index finger of your non-dominant hand against the wrist of your dominant hand. Then, slightly rotate your wrist back and forth a couple of times.
Place your hand underneath your chin with your palm oriented down. Then, bend your fingers down a couple of times.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented toward yourself. Your hands should be pointing up when you begin, then you should bend your hands down until your hands are pointing away from yourself.
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented down and your index and middle fingers pointing forward. Then, slightly move your hands forward a couple of times.
With your hand in front of you in a "1" handshape and your palm oriented away from yourself, wiggle your index finger from side to side a couple of times.
Move the fingertips of your dominant hand into the gap in-between the thumb and your other fingers of your non-dominant hand 2 times.
Begin with your palms against each other with your fingers facing forward. Then, open your hands up until your palms are oriented upwards.
With your hands oriented toward each other, move them both in a staggered, circular motion that move from above your shoulders to in front of your face a couple of times.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented toward yourself. Then, move your hands forward while rotating your wrist forward until your palms are oriented away from yourself.
Begin with your hand in a "5" handshape with the thumb of your hand touching your chest. Then move your hand away from yourself while slightly rotating your wrist.

Begin with your dominant hand inside the gap between the thumb and other fingers of your non-dominant hand. Then, move your dominant hand out and away from your non-dominant hand while bringing your fingertips together.

definition: Living organism that moves and feeds.
instruction: Begin with the fingertips of both hands touching near your shoulders. Move your wrists inwards a couple of times while keeping your fingertips in the same area.
This sign is a combination of the signs for "car" and "person"

Begin with the pinkie side of your dominant hand on the thumb side of your dominant hand with both palms oriented toward yourself. Bend your wrists forward a couple of times while keeping your hands together.
Place your hand in front of you and sign the letters "P" then "O".
Begin with your index finger below your mouth and your palm oriented towards yourself. Then bring your hand forward until your index finger is pointing away from yourself.

Begin with both hands in a "1" handshape. The index finger of your dominant hand should be touching your chin. Both hands should begin with your palms oriented away from yourself and your wrists bent back. Then you should bend both wrist forwards until your palms are oriented downwards.
Point directly in front of yourself with your index finger while moving your hand slightly forward.

Place your hand in front of you with your index, middle, and ring fingers facing up, with your index finger closest to your chin. Then move your hand to your face and make contact with your index finger to your chin 2 times.
With both hands next to each other in front of you, stagger making a forward circular motion with each hand a couple of times.

Begin with both hands in front of you with your non-dominant hand closer to yourself and both palms oriented toward yourself. Then, bend both wrists forward so that your palms are oriented away from yourself.

To sign "They" in ASL, extend your dominant index finger and point toward the group of people or the space you have assigned to them. Move your hand in a small, horizontal sweeping motion or arc while pointing.

Place your hand in front of your face with your thumb and index fingers near your nose. Move your hand down a couple of times, bringing your thumb and index fingers together as you move your hand down. This sign mimics a person wiping their nose because of having a cold.

Begin with your dominant hand facing towards yourself and your fingers touching your mouth. Bring your dominant hand down to your non-dominant hand while rotating your wrist so that the sign ends with both hands facing towards each other with your hands together.
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented up. Then, slightly move your hands from side to side in opposite directions a couple of times.
Mimic the motion of putting a rotary phone up to the side of your head, by place your hand up to the side of your head, with your pinkie near your chin and your thumb at your ear.

Begin with your palm oriented toward yourself and the fingertips of your hand next to the side of your forehead. Then, move your hand in a circular motion around the side of your forehead while moving your fingers in different directions up and down.
Begin with your hands next to each other and away from your body. Bring both hands toward yourself while bringing your fingertips together.

definition: Possessive pronoun meaning belonging to you.
instruction: With your palm oriented forward, away from yourself, move your hand slightly forward.

Begin with your dominant hand on top of the index finger side of your non-dominant hand with your thumb and index fingers grabbing onto your other hand. Then, move your hands slightly forward a couple of times.
Place your fingertips on the cheek closer to your hand and then move your fingertips over to your other cheek.
Begin with your hands pointing down and placed next to the sides of your chest. Then, bring your fingers into contact with your chest a couple of times, while curling in your fingertips.
Sign "art" then "person".

Begin with your hand in an "A" handshape, with your thumb touching your forehead. Then, bring your hand down and touch your thumb on the center of your chest, and changing your handshape to a "5" handshape a you move down.
Place both hands in front of you with your dominant hand underneath your non-dominant hand. Tap the top of your dominant hand against the bottom of your non-dominant hand
Place the pinkie side of your dominant hand on the palm of your non-dominant hand.
With your hand in front of you, oriented to the inside, and your pinkie pointing away from you, slightly wiggle your wrist back and forth a few times.
Begin with your thumb touching the side of your chin with your palm oriented forward. Then, rotate your wrist forward until your thumb is pointing up.

Begin with both hands next to each other with the palm side of each hand against each other in front of you. Then, keeping the fingertips of your hands together, move your palms away from each other, mimicking a wallet opening up.

To sign "He," simply act as though you are tipping the brim of a hat. Bring your dominant hand up to your forehead with your fingers together and palm facing in, then move it slightly away from your forehead in a short, forward motion.
Begin with both hands in front of you with your dominant hand on top of your non-dominant hand. Then, move your dominant hand around in a circle on top of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.

definition: Darkest color from absence of light.
instruction: Begin with your index finger pointing towards just past the far side of your forehead. Then, move your finger across your forehead.
Begin with your hand in front of your mouth with your fingertips pointing at your mouth. Then, move your hand away from your mouth while opening up your handshape into a "5" handshape.

definition: Go to see someone or someplace.
instruction: Begin with both hands next to each other close to your chest with your palms oriented toward yourself. Then, move both hands in unison forward, away from yourself.
Begin with your hand next to your face with your fingertips touching your cheek. Then, rotate your wrist while moving your hand away from your face.

definition: A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
instruction: Begin with your index fingers oriented toward each other, with your dominant hand oriented away from yourself and your non-dominant hand oriented toward yourself. Bring your index fingers toward each other until they make contact and then rotate your hands so that your palm orientations are reversed and then make contact with your index fingers again.
Place your hand in front of you in a "5" handshape, then move it back toward yourself, while changing it to a "S" handshape.
Begin with your the thumb of your hand touching your chin and your other fingers pointing up. Then, move your hand down and touch your thumb against the center of your chest.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented toward yourself, and your hands diagonal so that your fingers are pointing at your chin. The fingertips of your dominant hand should be touching your chin. Then, move your hands forward a couple of times.

definition: The seventh day of the week.
instruction: Begin with both hands in front of you with your palms oriented away from yourself. Then, move both hands in a circle 2 times. The circle on both hands should begin by moving slightly down and then towards the other hand.
With your hand in front of you and oriented away from yourself, move your hand in a circle a couple of times.
Begin with your dominant hand on top of the palm of your non-dominant hand. Bring your dominant hand forward as if handing some money to someone.
WIth your hand in front of you in an "M" handshape and your palm oriented towards yourself, move your hand in a circular motion once or twice.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you and with your palms oriented toward each other. Then, move your hands away from each other, rotating your wrists back as you move so the your palms are oriented away from yourself at the end of the sign.
Place your dominant hand down on the palm of your non-dominant hand and drag your fingers across your palm a couple of times, mimicking a writing motion.

definition: Piece of furniture with a writing surface.
instruction: Place both arms horizontally in front of you with the arm of your dominant hand on top. Move the arm of your dominant hand slightly up and down a couple times, tapping the arm of your non-dominant hand.
Begin with both hands in front of you with your palms oriented upwards and your hands starting closer to the arm of your dominant hand. Then move your hands away from yourself.

definition: One of twelve divisions of a year.
instruction: Place your non-dominant hand in front of you with your palm oriented away from yourself. Place the index finger of your dominant hand horizontally behind the top of the index finger of your non-dominant hand. Then, move your hand down the back of your index finger.
This sign is a combination of the signs for "teach" and "person".
Begin with your hand in front of your chest with your palm oriented toward yourself and your fingers horizontal. Move your hand up and toward yourself a couple of times.
Begin with your dominant hand above your non-dominant hand, and then tap the pinkie side of your dominant hand on the thumb side of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.
This sign is a combination of the signs for "law" and "person".
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your fingertips pointing down. Then, rotate your hands slightly forward a couple of times.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your fingers pointing away from you and your hands in a horizontal position. Rotate your wrists up and move your hands away from each other, ending with your palms oriented toward each other.

Place your non-dominant hand in front of you with your palm orientation facing up. Your dominant hand should begin slightly above your non-dominant hand with your thumb facing up. The movement of this sign is done by tapping your dominant hand on your non-dominant hand 2 times.
Begin with your fingertips against your chest, then move your hand up to your face while opening up your handshape into a "5" handshape.

Begin with your non-dominant hand underneath the elbow of your dominant hand. The forearm of your dominant hand should be vertical and your dominant hand should be oriented toward yourself. Move your forearm down until your dominant hand is on top of the forearm of your non-dominant hand.
Using an "I" handshape, begin with your hand away from yourself and bring it in until you touch your chest.
Begin with both hands next to each other with your palms oriented down and your thumbs touching each other. Then, move your dominant hand down.
Begin with your hand against your chest with your palm oriented towards yourself. Move your hand in a circular motion around your chest once or twice.

Place your hand in front of the side of your mouth with your index finger pointing up and your hand oriented toward yourself. Tap your hand against the side of your mouth with your fingertips 2 times.
Begin with both hands in front of you with your palms oriented up and your fingers pointing away from you. Then, move your hands toward each other a couple of times.
Begin with the fingertips against the side of your chin and then move your hand up and place your fingertips higher up on your face.
Begin with your index finger touching the side of your mouth, then move your hand off of your face and rotate your wrist to the inside and touch your middle finger on the side of your mouth.
Place the curled index and middle fingers of your dominant hand over the extended index and middle fingers of your non-dominant hand.

Place both hands in front of you, with the index finger of your non-dominant hand horizontal and the curled fingers of your dominant hand on top of the index finger. Then slide your dominant hand from side to side a couple of times while staying in contact with your index finger.

Begin with both hands in front of you with the palm of your non-dominant hand facing up and the palm of your dominant hand facing down. Then, bring your dominant hand down and tap your palms together 2 times.

definition: Sandy shore by a body of water.
instruction: Begin with both hands in front of you with your non-dominant hand oriented downward. Start with your dominant hand slightly above and behind your non-dominant hand. Bring it forward, passing over the back of your non-dominant hand 2 times. Wiggle all of your fingers except for your thumb as you move your dominant hand. This sign mimics waves crashing against a beach.
Place the tips of your thumb and index fingers against the side of your mouth and rotate your wrist slightly back and forth a couple of times.

Begin with both hands in a "Y" handshape. Your hands should be in front of you with your thumbs touching. Then, with your thumbs still together, rotate your dominant hand wrist so that your pinkie moves downwards a couple of times.
Begin with both hands next to each other with palm oriented toward each other. Then, bring your hands toward each other until they make contact.

Begin with both hands in front of you with the index and middle fingers of your dominant hand slightly above the index and middle fingers of your non-dominant hand. Move your dominant hand down onto your non-dominant hand 2 times. This sign mimics someone sitting on a chair.
Press your index finger of your dominant hand against the palm of your non-dominant hand. Then, rotate the wrist of your dominant hand back and forth a couple of times.

Begin with both hands in front of your with your dominant hand on top of your non-dominant hand and your palms oriented toward each other. Then, move your dominant hand up. This sign mimics the shape of a slice of cake.

Begin with your dominant hand above the back of your non-dominant hand. Then, bring your dominant hand down until the pinkie side of your dominant hand makes contact with the back of your non-dominant hand.
With both hands oriented towards each other, slide your dominant hand across the palm of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.
Place the back of your hand against your mouth and move your thumb and index fingers up and down a couple of times, mimicking a bird's mouth moving up and down.

Begin with both hands away from you in a "5" handshape, with your dominant hand on top of your non-dominant hand. Then bring both hands towards yourself, while changing your hands into an "S" handshape.
Begin with your thumb and index fingers against the edge of your mouth. Then, bring your hand down and slide it across your palm.

Begin with the index finger of your dominant hand touching your mouth and the palm of your non-dominant hand laid out in front of you. Bring your dominant hand down to your palm, bringing the fingertips of your thumb and index fingers together as you touch your palm. After touching your palm, slightly lift your dominant hand up, bringing the fingertips of your thumb and index finger apart, and then bring it back down to your palm one more time.

definition: Unit of time equal to 60 minutes.
instruction: With both of your hands oriented towards each other, make a "1" handshape with your dominant hand and move it in a circular motion.
With your hand in front of you and facing away from yourself in an "S" handshape, move your hand in a small circle a couple of times.
Tap the fingertips of your index and middle fingers on both sides of your face.
Begin with your hand next to your chin with your thumb touching your chin. Then, move your hand off of your face and place your thumb against the side of your face near your ear.
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented down and your index and middle fingers pointing forward. Then, slightly move your hands forward a couple of times.
Begin with your hand in front of you with your palm oriented away from yourself. Then, move your hand slightly forward and to the side while keeping your palm oriented away from yourself.

definition: Question word asking for a choice.
instruction: Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your thumbs pointing up. Then, move your hands in alternate directions up and down a couple of times.

definition: Time taken by Earth to orbit the sun.
instruction: Begin with both hands in front of you with the pinkie side of your dominant hand on top of the thumb side of your non-dominant hand. Then, move your hands in a circle around each other, with your hands ending up back where they began. Your dominant hand should move forward first, and your dominant hand should move backwards first when making the circular motion.
Begin with both hands in front of you, next to each other, with your thumbs pointing up. Then, move both hands toward yourself, while changing your handshapes to "A" handshapes.

Begin with both hands in front of you, with the index finger of your non-dominant hand pointing up and the back of the index finger of your dominant hand touching your other index finger. Move your dominant hand back and away from your non-dominant hand while curling your index finger in.
Tap the thumb side of your dominant hand against the opposite side of your chest a couple of times. This sign mimics the outline of a police badge.

Begin with your index and middle fingers pointing up and your hand near the opposite side of your forehead. Then, bring the thumb side of your hand against that side of your forehead, then bring it across and make contact with the other side of your forehead.
With your hand underneath your chin and your palm oriented toward yourself, tap the fingertip of your index finger on your chin a couple of times.
Begin with your fingers in front of your mouth with your palm oriented toward yourself. Wiggle all of your fingers a few times.

definition: Be aware of through observation or inquiry.
instruction: Tap your fingertips against the side of your head 2 times.
Press the pinkie side of your dominant hand against the thumb side of your non-dominant hand, beginning with your dominant hand above your non-dominant hand

Begin with your hand next to the side of your face with your hand oriented toward yourself. Begin with some separation between your thumb and middle fingers, then move your hand away from your face and bring the tips of your thumb and middle fingers together. Make this motion a couple of times. This sign mimics making the outline of cat whiskers.

Begin with your dominant hand slightly in front of your non-dominant hand. Move your dominant hand back 2 times, with the fingertips of your dominant hand making contact with the fingertips of your non-dominant hand.
Begin with both hands in an "F" handshape close to your body. Then move your hands slightly away from yourself.
This sign is a combination of the signs for "manage" and "person".
Begin with your hand in front of your forehead, then move your hand over the top of your head and then to the back of your head, mimicking a lion's mane.
Place your palm against the side of your head and tilt your head to the side, mimicking someone putting their hand underneath their head as they go to bed.
With both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented forward, slightly move your hands forward 2 times.

definition: End of the week typically Saturday and Sunday.
instruction: Begin with your dominant hand above the fingertips of your non-dominant hand. Your non-dominant hand should be pointing to the side and oriented toward yourself. Your dominant hand should be pointing away from you. Then, move your dominant hand to the side, just past your the fingertips of your non-dominant hand, and then move it down past your non-dominant hand while opening up your hand.

With your dominant hand above your non-dominant hand, place the tips of your thumb and index fingers of your dominant hand in the gap inside of your curled in index finger of your non-dominant hand. Then, move the fingertips of your thumb and index fingers in a circular motion inside of that gap.

definition: Having lived for a long time.
instruction: Begin with the index finger side of your hand against your chin and then move your hand down, slightly moving your hand from side to side as your hand moves down.
With your palm orientation towards yourself, place your fingertips against your mouth. Tap your fingertips against your mouth 2 times.

definition: A color between blue and yellow.
instruction: Begin with your hand in front of you with your thumb and index fingers pointing to the side. Then, you should rotate your hand to the other side while also moving your hand to the outside.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your thumbs touching each other and your palms oriented down. Move both of your hands forward while curling in your index fingers a few times.
Place the fingertips of your hand in front of the side of your face. Then, move your fingertips toward your face and then slightly away a couple of times, mimicking the stripes of a tiger's face.

definition: Move from one place to another.
instruction: Begin your hand above your shoulder, and then move it away from yourself. As your hand moves, your fingers should wiggle and then change into an "S" handshape.
Using an "F" handshape and your palm oriented away from yourself, make a circular motion two times.
Begin with your hand next to the side of your head with your thumb pointing toward your ear. Then, move your thumb toward your ear while curling your index and middle fingers in.

Place your non-dominant hand underneath the elbow of your dominant hand. The forearm of your dominant hand and your dominant hand should be vertical with your palm oriented to the side. Tap your elbow on the top of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.
Tap the fingertips of your index and middle fingers of your dominant hand on the wrist of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.

Begin with the index finger of your non-dominant hand against the wrist of your dominant hand. Begin with the index and middle fingers of your dominant hand extended, then bend them in a couple of times.
With your hand in an "H" handshape an your palm oriented towards yourself, move it in a circular motion 2 times.
This sign is a combination of the signs for "think" and "disappear".
Begin with your hand in front of you and in a "5" handshape. Then, change your handshape to an "S" handshape 2 times. This sign mimics squeezing a cow's udder.

definition: Possessive pronoun meaning belonging to me.
instruction: Place the palm side of your hand horizontally on your chest.

Begin with the fingertips of your dominant hand on top of the fingertips of your non-dominant hand. Both palms should be oriented down and your fingers should be pointing away from you. Then, slide the fingertips of your dominant hand across the back of your non-dominant hand to your wrist.

definition: Look at and comprehend written words.
instruction: Point the index and middle fingers of your dominant hand at the palm of your non-dominant hand. Then, move the index and middle fingers of your dominant hand up and down while staying pointed at the palm side of your non-dominant hand. This side mimics eyes reading a page from a book.

definition: Early part of the day after sunrise.
instruction: Begin with your non-dominant hand inside the elbow of your dominant hand. The forearm of your dominant hand should be laid out horizontally in front of your with your palm oriented upward. Then, you should move your forearm up toward yourself until your forearm and hand are vertical.
Begin with both hands in front of your face with your palms oriented toward yourself and your dominant hand in a slightly higher position. Then, move both hands down past your face.
Place your non-dominant hand in front of you, and then place your dominant hand in a "D" handshape with your fingertips near your wrist. Then, tap your wrist with your fingertips 2 times.
Begin with your hand in front of your face with the fingertips of your hand pointing at the top of your head. Then, move your hand down to your chin while bringing your fingertips together.
With your hand in a "T" handshape and your palm oriented away from yourself, move your hand in a circle once or twice.
Begin with the fingertips of both hands in front of each shoulder. Then, move both your hands toward yourself until they touch your chest.
Begin with hand in front of you with your palm oriented up and your fingers pointing away from yourself. Then, move your hand forward.
Begin with your palm oriented toward yourself and the fingertips of your index and middle fingers in front of your eyes. Then, move your hand away from yourself.
Begin with your hand below your chin with the tip of your index finger touching your chin and your hand oriented toward yourself. Then, move your hand down while curling in your index finger.
Begin with both hands in front of your chest with your dominant hand above your non-dominant hand. Then, move both hands away from you.

Place your dominant hand in front of you with your palm oriented upward. Begin with your dominant hand close to you with its palm oriented towards yourself. Then bring your dominant hand down onto the palm of your non-dominant hand.

definition: The period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.
instruction: With both hands oriented down in front of you with your dominant hand on top of your non-dominant hand, tap the palm side of your dominant hand down on the back of your non-dominant hand 2 times.
Begin with both hands in front of you with your palms oriented upward. Then bring both hands toward yourself, bending your wrists down as you move, and ending with your palms oriented downward.

Begin with your hand near yourself with your index and middle fingers pointing down. Then, move your hand forward while moving your index and middle fingers in opposite directions forward and backward mimicking a person walking.
Begin with your dominant hand on top of the base of your your palm with both palms oriented toward each other. Then, slide your dominant hand across your non-dominant hand.

definition: Short green plants forming a lawn.
instruction: With your palm oriented upward and your fingers pointing away from yourself, bring your hand up and touch the base of your palm on the bottom of your chin a couple times.
Rotate your wrist back and forth a couple of times, gesturing as if your are drinking water from a cup.

Begin with the index and middle fingers of your dominant hand on top of the index and middle fingers of your non-dominant hand. Rotate your wrists with your hands moving downward until your palms are oriented downward.
With your hand in a "W" handshape and your palm oriented towards yourself, move your hand in a circle once or twice.

definition: Word used to identify a person or thing.
instruction: Tap the side of the middle finger of your dominant hand onto the side of the index finger of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.
Begin with both hands close to your body and against each other. Then, move your dominant hand away from yourself.

Begin with both hands in front of you with your non-dominant hand farther away from you and your dominant hand near your body. Then bring your index fingers of your dominant hand up to the back of the index fingers of your non-dominant hand.

Tap your forehead with your index finger, place both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented toward each other. Begin with your hands on the dominant hand side of your body and then move them over to the non-dominant hand side of your body.
With your dominant hand in a "T" handshape, move it in a circle in front of the palm of your non-dominant hand and then place your dominant hand against the palm of your non-dominant hand.
With your hand in front of you and oriented away from yourself, begin with your thumb, middle, and index fingers extended, and then bring those fingertips together.
With your hand in front of you, slightly rotate your wrist side to side a couple of times.
Move the fingertips of your dominant hand across the back of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.

Place the index finger of your non-dominant hand horizontally in front of you. Then, move the fingertips of your dominant hand across the top of your index finger while also moving your hand up and down.
Begin with your thumb touching the side of your forehead and your hand oriented away from yourself. Slightly rotate your wrist back and forth a couple of times.
Begin with your hand in front of your face with the fingertips of your thumb and index finger pointing at your nose, then rotate your wrist down so that your hand is oriented down.

Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with the fingertips of your index fingers touching each other. Then, move your dominant hand in a circular motion that first begins by moving forward and down, and then ending with your index fingers touching each other again.

With your hand oriented toward yourself and below one side of your chin, bend your index and middle fingers down, making contact with the side of your chin, then move your hand over to the other side of your chin and make the same motion.
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented toward each other. Slightly move your hands toward each other a couple of times.
With your hand in front of you in an "S" handshape and your palm oriented away from yourself, bend your wrist down a couple of time. This is mimics the movement of a head moving up and down.
Begin with your hands next to each other in front of you. The thumb side of your hands should be touching. Then, move your hands away from each other, and then down.
Begin with both hands next to each other in front of you with your palms oriented up and slightly move your hands down a couple of times.

Begin with both hands in front of you and next to each other, with your hands touching on the index finger side of your hands. Rotate the wrist of your dominant hand inward toward yourself a couple of times.. This sign mimics a door opening.

Begin with your the thumb of your dominant hand touching the side of your forehead, then bring your dominant hand down and touch the thumb of your dominant hand on the thumb of your non-dominant hand.
Begin with the side of your index finger against your forehead and then move your hand up and away from your head.

Begin with both hands in front of you with your dominant hand closer to you, your hands pointing up, and your palms oriented to the side in opposite directions. Begin with your hands slightly away from each other and then have them make contact with each other 2 times.
Begin with your middle finger touching the side of your forehead. Then, move your hand down and slightly away from yourself while curling in your middle finger.

definition: Opening in a wall for light or air.
instruction: Begin with the fingers of your dominant hand above the fingers of your non-dominant hand with the fingers of both hands pointing to the side. Then, bring your dominant hand down on top of your non-dominant hand a couple of times.
Snap your fingers a couple of times.
Begin with the back of your hand touching your nose. Then bring your hand down, forwards, then up, mimicking the outline of an elephant's trunk.
Move the bottom of your dominant hand along the back of the wrist of your non-dominant hand 2 times.

definition: Question word asking about manner or process.
instruction: Place both hands in front of you with your palms oriented towards each other. Slightly rotate your dominant hand forwards a couple of times, while keeping your non-dominant hand still.

To sign "His," form an open flat palm with your dominant hand (fingers together and straight). Push your palm directly toward the person you are referring to, or toward the space in the air where you have established their presence. This open-palm gesture is distinct from pointing and is used specifically to indicate possession.
